summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Correctional Systems Officer regarding the official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The document lists attachments including interview transcripts, warnings forms, and various prison logs and rosters from August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation into his death while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of a Correctional Systems Officer regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prison Logs and Activity
events.description: Various MCC New York prison logs, rosters, and count documentation were generated, which are attached as evidence to the investigation.

events.title: Prison Logs and Activity
events.description: Continued prison logs and count documentation from MCC New York, attached to the investigation file.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an official investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
A voluntary interview of a BOP Correctional Systems Officer was conducted on July 15, 2021, as part of this investigation.
The document references and attaches numerous prison records from August 9-10, 2019, including daily assignment rosters, activity reports, and inmate count logs from MCC New York.
The identities of the interviewing agents and the interviewed officer are redacted in this cover memorandum.
